I have moderate eczema around my eyes and on my eyelids. Because of concern that longterm use of steroidal cream would cause thinning of the skin, cataracts and glaucoma, I decided to try EpiCeram. Having read some Stanford medical researchers write about the new theory that the cause of eczema is that it is not an autoimmune disorder, but rather a breakdown in the skin's natural barriers due to excessive dryness, I thought EpiCeram would be a great way to treat my problem. After trying it for 5 days, I have noticed a significant improvement in appearance, and the itching, irritation, and swelling is almost gone. The only problem with this cream is that the vapors it gives off when initially drying do irritate the eyes. If you close your eyes for about 10-15 minutes after application, however, you can avoid this entirely.
